title: US judge blocks Louisiana from requiring Ten Commandments in classrooms - Yahoo! Voices
description: A federal judge on Tuesday declared unconstitutional a Louisiana law requiring that the Ten Commandments be displayed in all public school classrooms in the state.  The decision by U.S. District Judge John deGravelles, who called the law "discriminatory and coercive," is a temporary setback for conservative groups trying to make expressions of faith more prominent in society.  Public schools are often already battlegrounds in the U.S., where the exercise of religious rights and the desire not to let state and local officials favor one religion over another often conflict.
